summary: The document, part of the JFK Assassination Records released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, originates from the FBI. It delves into Cuban political activities, highlighting revolutionary figures such as Alberto Bayo. The document, classified as 'Secret' and last reviewed in 1998, details communications between the FBI and CIA concerning the dismissal of the Cuban Ambassador and rumors regarding his potential replacement.
key_findings: The document is a segment of the JFK Assassination Records.
Focuses on Cuban political activities and mentions revolutionary figures, including Alberto Bayo.
Discusses the dismissal of the Cuban Ambassador and speculates about his successor, possibly linked to Alberto Bayo.
Emphasizes the interaction between the FBI and CIA on these issues.
Classified as 'Secret' with its last review in 1998.
